pages.text: Ichthyostega was one of the first tetrapods in the fossil record. It possessed lungs and limbs to help it navigate through the shallow waters. Ichthyostega had a fish like spinal structure though its appearance resembled a salamander. On land, it likely dragged itself around similar to the movements of a mudskipper on land.
$(l)Eats:$() Raw/Cooked Fish$(br)$(l)Breeds with:$() Raw Fish$(br)$(l)Egg Type:$() Spawn like Eggs$(br)$(l)Method of Obtaining:$() Egg Collection Phial
